Theorem 2.5: [Continuous maps preserve compactness] If is continuous between metric spaces and Unknown identifier `K`sorry sorry : PropK Unknown identifier `X`X is compact, then the image Unknown identifier `f`sorry '' sorry : Set ?m.2f '' Unknown identifier `K`K is compact.

theorem continuous_maps_preserve_compactness {X Y : Type*} [MetricSpace X] [MetricSpace Y] {f : X Y} (hf : Continuous f) {K : Set X} (hK : IsCompact K) : IsCompact (f '' K) := by simpa using hK.image hf

Helper for Proposition 2.15: a continuous real-valued function on a compact metric space is bounded in absolute value.

lemma helperForProposition_2_15_abs_bound {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X] [CompactSpace X] {f : X } (hf : Continuous f) : M : , x : X, |f x| M := by have hcompact : IsCompact (Set.univ : Set X) := isCompact_univ have hcont : ContinuousOn f (Set.univ : Set X) := hf.continuousOn rcases hcompact.exists_bound_of_continuousOn hcont with C, hC refine C, ?_ intro x have hxmem : x (Set.univ : Set X) := by simp have hnorm : f x C := hC x hxmem simpa [Real.norm_eq_abs] using hnorm

Helper for Proposition 2.15: existence of points attaining the maximum and minimum on a compact metric space.

lemma helperForProposition_2_15_exists_argmax_argmin {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X] [CompactSpace X] {f : X } (hf : Continuous f) (hne : Nonempty X) : x_max x_min : X, ( x : X, f x f x_max) ( x : X, f x_min f x) := by letI : Nonempty X := hne have hcompact : IsCompact (Set.univ : Set X) := isCompact_univ have hcont : ContinuousOn f (Set.univ : Set X) := hf.continuousOn have hne_univ : (Set.univ : Set X).Nonempty := Set.univ_nonempty rcases hcompact.exists_isMaxOn hne_univ hcont with x_max, _, hx_max rcases hcompact.exists_isMinOn hne_univ hcont with x_min, _, hx_min refine x_max, x_min, ?_, ?_ have hmax' : x : X, f x f x_max := by simpa [isMaxOn_univ_iff] using hx_max exact hmax' have hmin' : x : X, f x_min f x := by simpa [isMinOn_univ_iff] using hx_min exact hmin'

Proposition 2.15: [Maximum principle] Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d`d) be a compact metric space and continuous. (i) The function Unknown identifier `f`f is bounded on Unknown identifier `X`X. (ii) If Unknown identifier `X`sorry : PropX , then there exist such that Unknown identifier `f`f x_max is a maximum and Unknown identifier `f`f x_min is a minimum of Unknown identifier `f`f on Unknown identifier `X`X.

theorem maximum_principle {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X] [CompactSpace X] {f : X } (hf : Continuous f) : ( M : , x : X, |f x| M) (Nonempty X x_max x_min : X, ( x : X, f x f x_max) ( x : X, f x_min f x)) := by constructor exact helperForProposition_2_15_abs_bound hf intro hne exact helperForProposition_2_15_exists_argmax_argmin hf hne

Definition 2.6: [Uniform continuity] Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d_X`d_X) and (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `Y`Y, Unknown identifier `d_Y`d_Y) be metric spaces and . The function Unknown identifier `f`f is uniformly continuous on Unknown identifier `X`X if for every Unknown identifier ``sorry > 0 : Prop > 0 there exists Unknown identifier ``sorry > 0 : Prop > 0 such that for all , Unknown identifier `d_X`sorry < sorry sorry < sorry : Propd_X x x' < Unknown identifier `` Unknown identifier `d_Y`d_Y (f x) (f x') < Unknown identifier ``.

abbrev IsUniformlyContinuous {X Y : Type*} [MetricSpace X] [MetricSpace Y] (f : X Y) : Prop := UniformContinuous f

The predicate IsUniformlyContinuous.{u_1, u_2} {X : Type u_1} {Y : Type u_2} [MetricSpace X] [MetricSpace Y] (f : X Y) : PropIsUniformlyContinuous coincides with mathlib's UniformContinuous.{ua, ub} { : Type ua} { : Type ub} [UniformSpace ] [UniformSpace ] (f : ) : PropUniformContinuous.

lemma isUniformlyContinuous_iff_uniformContinuous {X Y : Type*} [MetricSpace X] [MetricSpace Y] (f : X Y) : IsUniformlyContinuous f UniformContinuous f := sorry

Theorem 2.7: Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d_X`d_X) and (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `Y`Y, Unknown identifier `d_Y`d_Y) be metric spaces and assume Unknown identifier `X`X is compact. For a function , Unknown identifier `f`f is continuous on Unknown identifier `X`X if and only if Unknown identifier `f`f is uniformly continuous on Unknown identifier `X`X.

theorem continuous_iff_uniformlyContinuous_of_compact {X Y : Type*} [MetricSpace X] [MetricSpace Y] [CompactSpace X] {f : X Y} : Continuous f IsUniformlyContinuous f := by constructor intro hf have huc : UniformContinuous f := CompactSpace.uniformContinuous_of_continuous (f := f) hf simpa [IsUniformlyContinuous] using huc intro hf have huc : UniformContinuous f := by simpa [IsUniformlyContinuous] using hf exact huc.continuous

Proposition 2.16: If and are uniformly continuous between metric spaces, then is uniformly continuous.

theorem uniformlyContinuous_comp {X Y Z : Type*} [MetricSpace X] [MetricSpace Y] [MetricSpace Z] {f : X Y} {g : Y Z} (hf : IsUniformlyContinuous f) (hg : IsUniformlyContinuous g) : IsUniformlyContinuous (g f) := by dsimp [IsUniformlyContinuous] at hf hg exact hg.comp hf

Helper for Proposition 2.17: Euclidean distance in is bounded by the sum of coordinate distances.

lemma helperForProposition_2_17_dist_finTwo_pair_le_add (a b c d : ) : dist (!2[a,b] : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2)) !2[c,d] dist a c + dist b d := by have hdist : dist (!2[a,b] : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2)) !2[c,d] = Real.sqrt (dist a c ^ 2 + dist b d ^ 2) := by simp [EuclideanSpace.dist_eq, Fin.sum_univ_two, pow_two] calc dist (!2[a,b] : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2)) !2[c,d] = Real.sqrt (dist a c ^ 2 + dist b d ^ 2) := hdist _ dist a c + dist b d := by have hnonneg1 : 0 dist a c := dist_nonneg have hnonneg2 : 0 dist b d := dist_nonneg have hsum_nonneg : 0 dist a c + dist b d := add_nonneg hnonneg1 hnonneg2 have hsq : dist a c ^ 2 + dist b d ^ 2 (dist a c + dist b d) ^ 2 := by nlinarith [hnonneg1, hnonneg2] exact (Real.sqrt_le_iff).2 hsum_nonneg, hsq

Helper for Proposition 2.17: coordinate-wise bound for paired maps.

lemma helperForProposition_2_17_dist_pair_le_add_coords {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X] {f g : X } (x y : X) : dist (!2[f x, g x] : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2)) !2[f y, g y] dist (f x) (f y) + dist (g x) (g y) := by simpa using (helperForProposition_2_17_dist_finTwo_pair_le_add (f x) (g x) (f y) (g y))

Proposition 2.17: Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d_X`d_X) be a metric space, and let be uniformly continuous. Equip with the standard metric . Define by . Then (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `f`f, Unknown identifier `g`g) is uniformly continuous.

theorem uniformlyContinuous_pair {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X] {f g : X } (hf : IsUniformlyContinuous f) (hg : IsUniformlyContinuous g) : IsUniformlyContinuous (fun x : X => !2[f x, g x] : X EuclideanSpace (Fin 2)) := by dsimp [IsUniformlyContinuous] at hf hg refine (Metric.uniformContinuous_iff).2 ?_ intro h have hf_eps := (Metric.uniformContinuous_iff).1 hf have hg_eps := (Metric.uniformContinuous_iff).1 hg have h2 : 0 < / 2 := by linarith rcases hf_eps ( / 2) h2 with f, hf_pos, hf rcases hg_eps ( / 2) h2 with g, hg_pos, hg refine min f g, ?_, ?_ exact (lt_min_iff).2 hf_pos, hg_pos intro x y hxy have hxy' : dist x y < f dist x y < g := (lt_min_iff).1 hxy have hfx : dist (f x) (f y) < / 2 := hf hxy'.1 have hgx : dist (g x) (g y) < / 2 := hg hxy'.2 have hdist_le : dist (!2[f x, g x] : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2)) !2[f y, g y] dist (f x) (f y) + dist (g x) (g y) := helperForProposition_2_17_dist_pair_le_add_coords x y have hsum_lt : dist (f x) (f y) + dist (g x) (g y) < := by have hsum : dist (f x) (f y) + dist (g x) (g y) < / 2 + / 2 := add_lt_add hfx hgx simpa [add_halves] using hsum exact lt_of_le_of_lt hdist_le hsum_lt

The map on , viewed as EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) : TypeEuclideanSpace (Fin 2).

def coordAdd : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) := fun p => p 0 + p 1

The map s(sorry, sorry) = sorry - sorry : Props(Unknown identifier `x`x,Unknown identifier `y`y)=Unknown identifier `x`x-Unknown identifier `y`y on , viewed as EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) : TypeEuclideanSpace (Fin 2).

def coordSub : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) := fun p => p 0 - p 1

The map on , viewed as EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) : TypeEuclideanSpace (Fin 2).

def coordMul : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) := fun p => p 0 * p 1

Helper for Proposition 2.18: each coordinate distance is bounded by the Euclidean distance.

lemma helperForProposition_2_18_dist_coord0_coord1_le_dist (p q : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2)) : dist (p 0) (q 0) dist p q dist (p 1) (q 1) dist p q := by have hdist : dist p q = Real.sqrt (dist (p 0) (q 0) ^ 2 + dist (p 1) (q 1) ^ 2) := by simp [EuclideanSpace.dist_eq, Fin.sum_univ_two, pow_two] have hcoord0 : dist (p 0) (q 0) dist p q := by have hsq : dist (p 0) (q 0) ^ 2 dist (p 0) (q 0) ^ 2 + dist (p 1) (q 1) ^ 2 := by nlinarith have hle : dist (p 0) (q 0) Real.sqrt (dist (p 0) (q 0) ^ 2 + dist (p 1) (q 1) ^ 2) := Real.le_sqrt_of_sq_le hsq simpa [hdist] using hle have hcoord1 : dist (p 1) (q 1) dist p q := by have hsq : dist (p 1) (q 1) ^ 2 dist (p 0) (q 0) ^ 2 + dist (p 1) (q 1) ^ 2 := by nlinarith have hle : dist (p 1) (q 1) Real.sqrt (dist (p 0) (q 0) ^ 2 + dist (p 1) (q 1) ^ 2) := Real.le_sqrt_of_sq_le hsq simpa [hdist] using hle exact hcoord0, hcoord1

Helper for Proposition 2.18: uniform continuity of coordAdd : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) coordAdd.

lemma helperForProposition_2_18_uniformlyContinuous_coordAdd : IsUniformlyContinuous coordAdd := by dsimp [IsUniformlyContinuous, coordAdd] refine (Metric.uniformContinuous_iff).2 ?_ intro h refine / 2, ?_, ?_ linarith intro p q hdist have hcoord := helperForProposition_2_18_dist_coord0_coord1_le_dist p q have hdist_le : dist (p 0 + p 1) (q 0 + q 1) dist (p 0) (q 0) + dist (p 1) (q 1) := dist_add_add_le _ _ _ _ have hsum_le : dist (p 0) (q 0) + dist (p 1) (q 1) dist p q + dist p q := by nlinarith [hcoord.1, hcoord.2] have hsum_lt : dist p q + dist p q < := by have hsum : dist p q + dist p q < / 2 + / 2 := add_lt_add hdist hdist simpa [add_halves] using hsum exact lt_of_le_of_lt (le_trans hdist_le hsum_le) hsum_lt

Helper for Proposition 2.18: uniform continuity of coordSub : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) coordSub.

lemma helperForProposition_2_18_uniformlyContinuous_coordSub : IsUniformlyContinuous coordSub := by dsimp [IsUniformlyContinuous, coordSub] refine (Metric.uniformContinuous_iff).2 ?_ intro h refine / 2, ?_, ?_ linarith intro p q hdist have hcoord := helperForProposition_2_18_dist_coord0_coord1_le_dist p q have hdist_le : dist (p 0 - p 1) (q 0 - q 1) dist (p 0) (q 0) + dist (p 1) (q 1) := dist_sub_sub_le _ _ _ _ have hsum_le : dist (p 0) (q 0) + dist (p 1) (q 1) dist p q + dist p q := by nlinarith [hcoord.1, hcoord.2] have hsum_lt : dist p q + dist p q < := by have hsum : dist p q + dist p q < / 2 + / 2 := add_lt_add hdist hdist simpa [add_halves] using hsum exact lt_of_le_of_lt (le_trans hdist_le hsum_le) hsum_lt

Helper for Proposition 2.18: coordMul : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) coordMul fails uniform continuity on .

lemma helperForProposition_2_18_not_uniformlyContinuous_coordMul : IsUniformlyContinuous coordMul := by dsimp [IsUniformlyContinuous, coordMul] intro huc have huc' := (Metric.uniformContinuous_iff).1 huc have h : 0 < (1 / 2 : ) := by norm_num rcases huc' (1 / 2 : ) h with , hpos, h rcases exists_nat_one_div_lt hpos with n, hn let t : := (n : ) + 1 have htpos : 0 < t := by have hpos : (0 : ) < (n : ) + 1 := by nlinarith simpa [t] using hpos have ht_ne : t 0 := ne_of_gt htpos let p : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) := !2[t, 0] let q : EuclideanSpace (Fin 2) := !2[t, 1 / t] have hdist_pq : dist p q < := by have hdist_eq : dist p q = |t| := by simp [p, q, EuclideanSpace.dist_eq, Fin.sum_univ_two, pow_two] have hdist_eq' : dist p q = t := by simpa [abs_of_pos htpos] using hdist_eq have hlt : t < := by simpa [t] using hn simpa [hdist_eq'] using hlt have hdist_mul_lt : dist (coordMul p) (coordMul q) < (1 / 2 : ) := h hdist_pq have hdist_mul_eq : dist (coordMul p) (coordMul q) = (1 : ) := by simp [coordMul, p, q, ht_ne] have hlt : (1 : ) < (1 / 2 : ) := by simpa [hdist_mul_eq] using hdist_mul_lt linarith

Proposition 2.18: On with the Euclidean metric and : Type with the usual metric, the maps and s(sorry, sorry) = sorry - sorry : Props(Unknown identifier `x`x,Unknown identifier `y`y)=Unknown identifier `x`x-Unknown identifier `y`y are uniformly continuous, whereas is not uniformly continuous.

lemma uniformlyContinuous_add_sub_not_mul : IsUniformlyContinuous coordAdd IsUniformlyContinuous coordSub IsUniformlyContinuous coordMul := by refine And.intro ?_ ?_ exact helperForProposition_2_18_uniformlyContinuous_coordAdd refine And.intro ?_ ?_ exact helperForProposition_2_18_uniformlyContinuous_coordSub exact helperForProposition_2_18_not_uniformlyContinuous_coordMul

Proposition 2.19: Let (sorry, sorry) : ?m.1 ?m.2(Unknown identifier `X`X, Unknown identifier `d`d) be a metric space and let be uniformly continuous. Then the functions Unknown identifier `f`sorry + sorry : ?m.5f + Unknown identifier `g`g and Unknown identifier `f`sorry - sorry : ?m.5f - Unknown identifier `g`g are uniformly continuous on Unknown identifier `X`X.

theorem uniformlyContinuous_add_sub {X : Type*} [MetricSpace X] {f g : X } (hf : IsUniformlyContinuous f) (hg : IsUniformlyContinuous g) : IsUniformlyContinuous (f + g) IsUniformlyContinuous (f - g) := by have hpair : IsUniformlyContinuous (fun x : X => !2[f x, g x] : X EuclideanSpace (Fin 2)) := uniformlyContinuous_pair hf hg have hadd : IsUniformlyContinuous (coordAdd (fun x : X => !2[f x, g x] : X EuclideanSpace (Fin 2))) := uniformlyContinuous_comp hpair helperForProposition_2_18_uniformlyContinuous_coordAdd have hsub : IsUniformlyContinuous (coordSub (fun x : X => !2[f x, g x] : X EuclideanSpace (Fin 2))) := uniformlyContinuous_comp hpair helperForProposition_2_18_uniformlyContinuous_coordSub refine And.intro ?_ ?_ simpa [Function.comp, coordAdd] using hadd simpa [Function.comp, coordSub] using hsub
